JobFullDesc: The FRL (Facebook Reality Labs) Wireless Platforms Hardware Team focuses on delivering Facebook's mission through a series of Virtual Reality (VR) and Augmented Reality (AR) products. The team is driving the state-of-the-art forward with breakthrough work in computer vision, machine learning, mixed reality, graphics, displays, sensors, and new ways to map the human body. Our systems will enable AR/VR devices where our real and virtual world will mix and match throughput the day. We believe the only way to achieve the goals is to look at the entire stack, from transistor, through architecture, to algorithm, protocol, and firmware implementation. Wireless communication is one of the key enabling technologies.We are seeking an experienced Wireless Systems Engineer, with a focus on standards to represent Facebook Inc.’s interest and strategy in various wireless networking standards bodies, with focus on WLAN and WPAN. You will be working with our FRL product teams to define/shape end-to-end wireless networking solutions, and work in the standards bodies to enable wider adoption of solutions via protocol standardization, as well as increasing interoperability.This is a full-time position, with significant travel requirements to international standards meetings as well as to other national and international Facebook sites.Participate in IEEE 802 WLAN/WPAN standardization and associated industry interoperability/specification programs (e.g. WFA)Conduct protocol performance analysis and evaluate wireless solutions for AR/VR products.
